Dear Mr. Dixon:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/29/21. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For repeat violations, note why the previous plan failed.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10113 Employee records.
(e) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations.
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within the
first 6 months of each position designated by these rules and
annually thereafter.
(e) One of four new employee files reviewed was found not to have completed a
criminal clearance or central registry clearance prior to hire. The clearances were
completed eight and ten days after hire.
(f) One of five applicable employee files did not contain the required performance
evaluation. This new hire was missing their six-month evaluation.
R 400.10115 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
A facility shall document that each employee and each
volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or more hours per
week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free from
communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 3-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 3 years after the last
verification.
One of seven employee files reviewed contained a Tuberculosis screening that was
completed 11 days after hire.
R 400.10175 Resident confinement room; procedures for use.
(6) During a resident's confinement, visual observations of the
resident shall be made by staff at least every 15 minutes. Each
contact shall be logged at the time of the observation.
One of three confinement logs reviewed did not have staff initials for the times the
youth was visually observed. This does not allow verification as to which staff did the
checks.

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
